\chapter{Architecture and Design}
\label{\detokenize{developer_guide:developer-guide}}\label{\detokenize{developer_guide::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This guide explains architecture and data flow of Opportunistic Network Data Analyzer (OppNDA).


\section{Architecture Overview}
\label{\detokenize{developer_guide:architecture-overview}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
OppNDA follows a modular architecture with clear separation of concerns:

\section{Data Flow}
\label{\detokenize{developer_guide:data-flow}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The typical data flow through OppNDA:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ONE Simulator} generates report files (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{*.txt}}) in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{reports/}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Averager} groups and averages reports by configuration parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Analysis} generates visualizations from averaged data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Regression} (optional) trains ML models on the data

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
ONE Simulator
     |
     v (report files)
+\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}+     +\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}+     +\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}+
|  Averager   |\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}|  Analysis   |\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZgt{}|  Regression |
|             |     |             |     |   (ML)      |
+\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}+     +\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}+     +\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}+

\chapter{Core Modules}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:core-modules}}\label{\detokenize{modules/core::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This section documents the core processing modules of OppNDA.


\section{averager}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:averager}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Report file averaging and aggregation.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!core.averager@\spxentry{core.averager}}\index{core.averager@\spxentry{core.averager}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\subsection{Report Averager Module}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:report-averager-module}}\label{\detokenize{modules/core:module-core.averager}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A flexible, high\sphinxhyphen{}performance tool for averaging multiple simulation report files.
Optimized with multiprocessing for enhanced performance on multi\sphinxhyphen{}core systems.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module processes report files generated by the ONE (Opportunistic Network
Environment) simulator and groups them based on configurable parameters,
calculating averages across multiple simulation runs.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Basic usage with default config:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{core}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{averager}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{ReportAverager}

\PYG{n}{averager} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ReportAverager}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{config/averager\PYGZus{}config.json}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{averager}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Command\sphinxhyphen{}line usage:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{core}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{averager}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module uses multiprocessing for parallel file reading. The number of
workers is dynamically calculated based on available RAM and CPU cores
when the ResourceManager is available.

\index{average\_group\_data() (in module core.averager)@\spxentry{average\_group\_data()}\spxextra{in module core.averager}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/core:core.averager.average_group_data}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.averager.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{average\_group\_data}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{aggregated}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate averages from aggregated data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Takes a dictionary of field names to lists of values and calculates
the mean for each field, properly handling NaN values.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{aggregated}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}}) – Dictionary mapping field names to lists of values.
Example: \{‘delivery\_prob’: {[}0.9, 0.92, 0.88{]}, ‘latency’: {[}100, 110, 105{]}\}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Dictionary mapping field names to their averaged values.}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Fields with no valid values are excluded from the result.

\end{description}


\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{metric1}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{2.0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{metric2}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nan}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{np}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{nan}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n}{avg} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{average\PYGZus{}group\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{g+gp}{\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{}\PYGZgt{} }\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{avg}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} \PYGZob{}\PYGZsq{}metric1\PYGZsq{}: 2.0, \PYGZsq{}metric2\PYGZsq{}: nan\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ReportAverager (class in core.averager)@\spxentry{ReportAverager}\spxextra{class in core.averager}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/core:core.averager.ReportAverager}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.averager.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ReportAverager}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{config\_path}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{safety\_enabled}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#object}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Report file averaging and aggregation engine.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class groups simulation report files based on configurable parameters
and calculates averages across multiple runs. It uses multiprocessing for
parallel file reading to maximize performance.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The averaging process:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Scans the reports directory for matching files

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Parses filenames to extract component values (router, TTL, buffer, etc.)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Groups files based on configured grouping parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reads files in parallel using multiprocessing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates averages for each metric within each group

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Writes averaged results to output files

\end{enumerate}

\section{analysis}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:analysis}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Data analysis and visualization generation.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!core.analysis@\spxentry{core.analysis}}\index{core.analysis@\spxentry{core.analysis}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\subsection{Analysis and Visualization Module}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:analysis-and-visualization-module}}\label{\detokenize{modules/core:module-core.analysis}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Smart adaptive analysis tool that automatically detects data patterns
and generates comprehensive visualizations from simulation results.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides a complete pipeline for analyzing report data:
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{File Parsing} \sphinxhyphen{} Intelligent parsing of both averaged and raw report files

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Data Organization} \sphinxhyphen{} Grouping and merging data by configurable parameters

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Plot Strategy} \sphinxhyphen{} Automatic determination of appropriate visualizations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Parallel Rendering} \sphinxhyphen{} Multiprocessing\sphinxhyphen{}based plot generation

\end{enumerate}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Classes:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
SmartFileParser: Parses report files and extracts structured data.
DataOrganizer: Organizes data for different visualization purposes.
PlotStrategy: Determines optimal plots based on data characteristics.
PlotGenerator: Creates matplotlib/seaborn visualizations.

\sphinxlineitem{Supported Plot Types:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Line plots (metrics vs parameters, grouped by router)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
3D surface plots (two parameters vs metric)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Violin plots (distribution visualization)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Correlation heatmaps

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Pairplots (multi\sphinxhyphen{}metric relationships)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Run analysis from command line:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{python} \PYG{n}{core}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{analysis}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Or use programmatically:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{core}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{analysis}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}config}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{SmartFileParser}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{DataOrganizer}

\PYG{n}{config} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}config}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{parser} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{SmartFileParser}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{config}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{organizer} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{DataOrganizer}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{parser}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{averaged\PYGZus{}data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{organizer}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{load\PYGZus{}averaged\PYGZus{}files}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\index{SmartFileParser (class in core.analysis)@\spxentry{SmartFileParser}\spxextra{class in core.analysis}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/core:core.analysis.SmartFileParser}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{SmartFileParser}}}
{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{config}}}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#object}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Intelligent file parser for averaged and raw simulation reports.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class handles parsing of both averaged report files (generated by
the averager module) and raw report files (directly from simulations).
It extracts structured data including metrics, router information,
and grouping parameters.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The parser automatically detects file types based on naming conventions
and applies appropriate parsing strategies.
\index{config (core.analysis.SmartFileParser attribute)@\spxentry{config}\spxextra{core.analysis.SmartFileParser attribute}}

and raw report files, merging data from multiple report types.

\section{resource\_manager}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:resource-manager}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Dynamic memory and CPU resource management.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!core.resource\_manager@\spxentry{core.resource\_manager}}\index{core.resource\_manager@\spxentry{core.resource\_manager}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/core:module-core.resource_manager}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Resource Manager \sphinxhyphen{} Dynamic Memory Management for OppNDA
Implements memory\sphinxhyphen{}aware worker optimization as described in the research paper.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Mathematical Models Implemented:
\sphinxhyphen{} Memory footprint: M(t) = M\_base + sum(gamma * size(r\_i) + M\_overhead)
\sphinxhyphen{} Optimal workers: P\_opt = max\{p in Z+ | M(t)|P=p <= eta * M\_RAM\}
\index{ResourceConfig (class in core.resource\_manager)@\spxentry{ResourceConfig}\spxextra{class in core.resource\_manager}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
A semaphore that dynamically adjusts based on available memory.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Implements: P\_opt = max\{p in Z+ | M(t)|P=p <= eta * M\_RAM\}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This prevents OS\sphinxhyphen{}level swap thrashing by capping concurrent workers
when memory pressure is detected.

\index{ResourceManager (class in core.resource\_manager)@\spxentry{ResourceManager}\spxextra{class in core.resource\_manager}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/core:core.resource_manager.ResourceManager}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\DUrole{k}{class}\DUrole{w}{ }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{core.resource\_manager.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ResourceManager}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#object}{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Central resource manager for OppNDA’s multiprocessing.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides:
\sphinxhyphen{} Dynamic worker count calculation based on available RAM
\sphinxhyphen{} Memory estimation for batch processing
\sphinxhyphen{} Configurable safety measures (can be disabled)
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Usage:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
rm = ResourceManager()
workers = rm.get\_optimal\_workers()

\sphinxAtStartPar
\# Or with safety disabled:
rm = ResourceManager(safety\_enabled=False)

\end{description}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{eta}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#float}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{gamma}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#float}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{overhead\_mb}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#float}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}})

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{safety\_enabled}} (\sphinxhref{https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html\#bool}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}})

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\section{path\_utils}
\label{\detokenize{modules/core:path-utils}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
Path utilities for cross\sphinxhyphen{}platform path handling and validation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides functions for:
\sphinxhyphen{} Resolving absolute paths from relative or user\sphinxhyphen{}specified paths
\sphinxhyphen{} Validating path existence and permissions
\sphinxhyphen{} Path normalization across Windows, Linux, macOS
\sphinxhyphen{} Safe path construction

\chapter{REST API}
\label{\detokenize{modules/api:rest-api-reference}}\label{\detokenize{modules/api::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This section documents the Flask REST API endpoints.


\section{api}
\label{\detokenize{modules/api:api}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Main API endpoints for configuration and execution.
\index{module@\spxentry{module}!app.api@\spxentry{app.api}}\index{app.api@\spxentry{app.api}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\subsection{REST API Module for OppNDA}
\label{\detokenize{modules/api:rest-api-module-for-oppnda}}\label{\detokenize{modules/api:module-app.api}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides RESTful API endpoints for the OppNDA GUI application.
It handles configuration management, settings persistence, and execution
of post\sphinxhyphen{}processing scripts.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Endpoints Summary:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Configuration:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
GET/POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/config/<name>}} \sphinxhyphen{} Read/write config files

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/save\sphinxhyphen{}all}} \sphinxhyphen{} Save all configurations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/save\sphinxhyphen{}settings}} \sphinxhyphen{} Save ONE simulator settings

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Execution:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/run\sphinxhyphen{}one}} \sphinxhyphen{} Run complete simulation pipeline

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/run\sphinxhyphen{}averager}} \sphinxhyphen{} Run report averaging

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/run\sphinxhyphen{}analysis}} \sphinxhyphen{} Run visualization generation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
POST \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/run\sphinxhyphen{}regression}} \sphinxhyphen{} Run ML regression

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Streaming (SSE):}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
GET \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/stream\sphinxhyphen{}averager}} \sphinxhyphen{} Stream averager output

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
GET \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/stream\sphinxhyphen{}analysis}} \sphinxhyphen{} Stream analysis output

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
GET \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{/api/stream\sphinxhyphen{}regression}} \sphinxhyphen{} Stream regression output

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\end{description}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Example}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Starting the API server:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{flask}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Flask}
\PYG{k+kn}{from}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nn}{app}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{api}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{api\PYGZus{}bp}

\PYG{n}{app} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Flask}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{app}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{register\PYGZus{}blueprint}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{api\PYGZus{}bp}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{url\PYGZus{}prefix}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{/api}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{app}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{run}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{port}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{5000}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\index{run\_one\_simulator() (in module app.api)@\spxentry{run\_one\_simulator()}\spxextra{in module app.api}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/api:app.api.run_one_simulator}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.api.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{run\_one\_simulator}}}
{}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Complete simulation pipeline: Save config \sphinxhyphen{}> Run ONE \sphinxhyphen{}> Post\sphinxhyphen{}processing.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This endpoint handles the entire workflow:
1. Saves simulation settings file (.txt)
2. Saves post\sphinxhyphen{}processing configs (JSON)
3. Detects OS and builds appropriate command
4. Runs ONE simulator with correct settings file and batch count
5. Auto\sphinxhyphen{}triggers post\sphinxhyphen{}processing when simulation completes

\end{fulllineitems}

‘is\_dir’: bool,
‘is\_file’: bool

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{auto\_save\_config() (in module app.api)@\spxentry{auto\_save\_config()}\spxextra{in module app.api}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{modules/api:app.api.auto_save_config}}

\pysiglinewithargsret
{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{app.api.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{auto\_save\_config}}}
{}
{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Auto\sphinxhyphen{}save configuration changes (silent endpoint for auto\sphinxhyphen{}save manager).

\sphinxAtStartPar
This endpoint handles incremental config saves from the UI without
user notifications. It merges changes with existing config to preserve
non\sphinxhyphen{}UI fields.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Request JSON:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
config: Config name (‘analysis’, ‘averager’, or ‘regression’)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
changes: Dict of field name \sphinxhyphen{}> value pairs

\end{itemize}

\end{description}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bool, ‘message’: str \}

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\{ ‘success’

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
